title: Dinosaurs from Dust - The World's Most Powerful Particle Smasher
abstractText:
In spring 2008 the start button for the biggest scientific experiment in the history of mankind will be pressed. The World’s most powerful particle smasher, aka The Large Hadron Collider, will recreate the conditions in our Universe less than one billionth of a second after it began in the Big Bang.

‘Dinosaurs from Dust – The World’s Most Powerful Particle Smasher’ was a family show using demonstrations and audience participation to reveal the science behind the project. The talk aimed to explore the immense scale of the experiment explain, using members of the audience, how the Large Hadron Collider works and describe some of the scientific questions the experiment will address.

The show lasted 45 minutes and was suitable for ages from 9 to 90.
